original: BETWEEN: ORGANIC PREPARATIONS INC.
ollama_generated:
UNDERSTANDING: ORGANIC PREPARATIONS INC.

In the event that Organic Preparations Inc., in its sole discretion, determines that a product it supplied does not meet industry standards or is deemed unsafe by regulatory bodies, Organic Preparations Inc. shall have the right, but not the obligation, to recall such product and provide replacement products at no additional cost to the recipient, provided that: (1) the recipient cooperates fully with any and all recall procedures requested by Organic Preparations Inc., and (2) the recipient agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Organic Preparations Inc. from any claims or damages arising from the recipient's use of the recalled product prior to its recall.

This clause inverts the condition slightly by shifting some of the responsibility for handling a recalled product from Organic Preparations Inc. to the recipient, while also clarifying that Organic Preparations Inc.'s recall action is discretionary rather than obligatory.

original: 2nd Floor, Transpacific Haus Lini Highway, Port Vila. Vanuatu (‘the Manufacturer’)  of one part AND: AGAPE ATP INTERNATIONAL HOLDING LIMITED Unit 05, 4F, Energy Plaza No. 92, Granville Road Tsim Sha Tsui East Kowloon, Hong Kong (‘the Customer’) of the other part.
ollama_generated:
2nd Floor, Transpacific Haus Lini Highway, Port Vila, Vanuatu (hereinafter referred to as "Manufacturer") and AGAPE ATP INTERNATIONAL HOLDING LIMITED, Unit 05, 4F, Energy Plaza No. 92, Granville Road Tsim Sha Tsui East Kowloon, Hong Kong (hereinafter referred to as "Customer"), in their mutual capacity as the parties hereto:

In the event that any dispute arises between the Manufacturer and the Customer in connection with this Agreement, the Customer shall have the first right of negotiation to resolve such dispute amicably. If, despite good faith efforts, the parties are unable to reach a resolution within thirty (30) days from the initiation of negotiations, then either party may submit the matter to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre, with the seat of arbitration being Hong Kong. The Manufacturer shall bear no responsibility for the costs of such arbitration, except for its own legal fees and expenses.

original: 1.3 Renewal This agreement will be automatically renewed at the end of every ten (10) year term, with each subsequent term of renewal being for a ten (10) year term. A six (6) months notice must be given by either party of their intention to terminate relations due to any reason other than breach of this agreement.
modified:
1.3 Term Extension
This agreement shall be extended indefinitely, with each subsequent extension period being for a ten (10) year term. A six (6) months prior written notice must be provided by either party if they wish to opt-out of this agreement for any reason other than a material breach. The responsibility for providing such notice falls upon the party who desires to terminate, and failure to provide the required notice may result in an extension of the agreement beyond the intended termination date.

original: 2.2 Provision by the Customer The Customer agrees to supply to the Manufacturer at its own expense, within a reasonable period of time, all documentation and information as is reasonably required by or would be beneficial to the Manufacturer in the performance of its obligations under this agreement.
ollama_generated:
2.2 Documentation and Information Provided by the Customer
The Manufacturer acknowledges that it may require certain documentation and information from the Customer for efficient execution of its duties under this agreement. The Customer is not obligated to provide such materials unless requested, and has the discretion to withhold any data deemed unnecessary or sensitive. If supplied, the Customer shall bear no responsibility for any delays incurred by the Manufacturer due to the lack of clarity, completeness, or accuracy of the provided information. The Manufacturer will use the customer-supplied documentation and information at its own expense and within a reasonable timeframe, as deemed necessary for the fulfillment of its obligations.

original: 3. COVENANTS BY THE MANUFACTURER 3.1 Compliance with Local Laws and Regulations The Manufacturer covenants that it is and will remain for the term of this agreement in compliance with any and all Local Laws and Regulations. This includes without limitation laws relating to business practice, workplace relations, safety and taxation.
ollama_generated:
3. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES BY THE MANUFACTURER
3.1 Compliance with Local Laws and Regulations
The Manufacturer represents and warrants that it has been, and as of the Effective Date of this Agreement, is in compliance with all relevant Local Laws and Regulations. However, the Manufacturer shall not be held liable for any claims or damages arising from its future non-compliance with any changes in Local Laws and Regulations beyond the Manufacturer's control, provided that such non-compliance is not due to gross negligence or willful misconduct on the part of the Manufacturer. This includes but is not limited to laws relating to business practice, workplace relations, safety, and taxation.

original: ODM Supply Agreement 3 Organic Preparations INC. & Agape ATP International Holding Limited Source: AGAPE ATP CORP, 10-K/A, 12/2/2019 3.5 (b) The composition of the below individuals is also relevant and related to the Intellectual Property of the Manufacturer.
ollama_generated:
3.5 (b) The intellectual property rights of the Manufacturer are significantly influenced and affected by the roles and compositions of the following individuals. In the event of any dispute regarding the intellectual property, it shall be incumbent upon these individuals to demonstrate their substantial contributions towards the development and protection of such intellectual property, as failure to do so may potentially lead to a release or waiver of their related rights.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for demonstrating contributions to the intellectual property is shifted from ODM Supply Agreement 3 Organic Preparations INC. (Manufacturer) to the individuals named in the agreement. This change weakens the obligation on the Manufacturer and potentially makes it more difficult for them to enforce their rights if a dispute arises. The clause also implies that failure by the individuals to provide evidence of their contributions may result in a loss or waiver of their associated rights, which is not explicitly stated in the original clause but is implied here.

original: In the event that the Manufacturer determines that the returned Product is defective and properly rejected by the Customer, the Manufacturer shall credit to the Customer the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs.
modified: Upon the Manufacturer's assessment that the submitted Product appears non-defective and is rejected incorrectly by the Customer, the Customer will be refunded the original product price and any reasonable return shipping costs incurred.

original: (ii) The remaining 50% of the total order cost must be paid prior to the goods leaving the warehouse of the manufacturer. The Manufacturer will notify the Customer when the goods are ready for shipment prior to the goods leaving the warehouse.
ollama_generated: (ii) Upon receiving notice from the Manufacturer that the goods are ready for shipment, the Customer shall promptly make payment for the remaining 50% of the total order cost. Goods will be dispatched from the manufacturer's warehouse following the completion of the payment process. The Manufacturer assumes no responsibility for any delays in shipping due to late payment by the Customer.

original: 7.3 Rights to termination Without prejudice to any right or remedy both parties may have against each other for breach or non-performance of this Agreement each party shall have the right to summarily terminate this Agreement:
ollama_generated:
7.3 Termination at will: Either party shall retain the discretionary power, without prejudice to any rights or remedies that may arise from a breach or non-performance of this Agreement, to terminate this contract at any time and for any reason, with or without cause, effective immediately upon providing written notice.

In this version, the party has discretionary power to terminate the agreement at any time (without cause), whereas in the original clause, the termination was only permitted due to a breach or non-performance of the agreement.

original: (a) On the committing of a material breach of this agreement providing that where the breach is capable of rectification the breaching party has been advised in writing of the breach and has not rectified it within twenty-one (21) days of receipt of such advice.
ollama_generated: (a) In the event of a material breach of this agreement, should rectification of the breach be possible, the party in default shall have a grace period of twenty-one (21) days from receipt of written notice to remedy the breach. However, failure to comply with this remediation timeline shall not be deemed as a waiver of the aggrieved party's right to terminate this agreement or seek other available legal remedies.

original: (b) On the commencement of the winding up or bankruptcy of either party or on the appointment of a receiver of the distributor’s assets or on either party ceasing to do business at any time for thirty consecutive days (other than for annual holidays).
ollama_generated: (b) In instances where either party voluntarily initiates winding up or bankruptcy proceedings, appoints a receiver for their assets, or suspends business operations for thirty consecutive days (excluding annual holidays), the non-initiating party shall not be held responsible for any resulting liabilities or obligations, provided they have fulfilled their contractual duties up to the cessation of business.

original: (d) On either party assigning or attempting to assign this agreement without the prior written consent of the other party.
ollama_generated: (d) Either party retains the right to transfer or attempt to transfer this agreement; however, such action requires the express, written approval from the non-transferring party before any such assignment becomes effective.

original: 9. COSTS Each of the parties shall bare its own legal costs and expenses incurred by it in connection with this agreement and any stamp duty payable under this agreement shall be borne by equally by both parties.
ollama_generated:
9. EXPENSES AND LEGAL FEES
In the event of any legal action or dispute arising from this Agreement, neither party shall seek reimbursement for their costs and expenses, including attorney fees, from the other. Any stamp duty payable under this Agreement shall initially be borne by the party incurring the expense, with a subsequent equal reimbursement to be made by both parties within 30 days of such payment.

original: 13. APPOINTMENT AND GRANT OF LICENSE 13.1 The Manufacturer hereby appoints the Customer to be the sole and exclusive agent for the promotion, sales, marketing, distribution and administration of the products listed in schedule A of this agreement based on minimum annual product purchase requirements as listed in Schedule B of this agreement.
modified:
13. APPOINTMENT AND GRANT OF LICENSE
13.1 The Customer hereby has the non-exclusive right to promote, sell, market, distribute, and administer the products listed in schedule A of this agreement, subject to the annual product purchase requirements as listed in Schedule B of this agreement, which the Manufacturer may fulfill directly or through other authorized agents.

This revision changes the exclusivity of the agent's rights, making it a non-exclusive appointment instead. The Manufacturer can now also sell the products directly or through other authorized agents without violating the terms of the agreement.

original: (i) The outbreak of hostilities (whether or not accompanied by any formal declaration of war), riot, civil disturbance, or acts of terrorism; or (ii) The act of any government or competent authority (including the cancellation or revocation of any approval, authority or permit); or (iii) Fire, explosion, flood, inclement weather, or natural disaster; or (iv) The declaration of a state of emergency or the invocation of martial law having an effect on commerce generally; or (v) Industrial action (including strikes and lock-outs) that is of a widespread nature affecting the Principal solely or the industry or sector of which the Principal is a part (whether in a vertical sense or horizontal sense); or (vi) Any other cause, impediment or circumstance beyond the reasonable control of any party.
ollama_generated:
The following events shall exempt a party from their contractual obligations:

(i) The onset of hostilities (whether declared or undeclared), civil unrest, disturbances, or acts of violence; or
(ii) The actions taken by any governmental entity or competent authority, including the withdrawal, suspension, or alteration of any approval, authorization, or permit; or
(iii) Fire, explosion, flooding, extreme weather conditions, or other natural calamities; or
(iv) The declaration of a state of emergency, martial law, or similar extraordinary measures that significantly impact commercial activities; or
(v) Widespread industrial action, such as strikes, lockouts, or labor disputes, affecting the industry or sector in which the principal operates, whether directly or indirectly; or
(vi) Any unforeseeable event or circumstance beyond the reasonable control of any party, including but not limited to acts of God, war, sabotage, or third-party interference.

original: ODM Supply Agreement 9 Organic Preparations INC. & Agape ATP International Holding Limited Source: AGAPE ATP CORP, 10-K/A, 12/2/2019 14.9 Other products outside of the product range listed in schedule A of this document The Manufacturer agrees that the Customer has the right under this agreement to consider, source, promote, market and sell other product outside of the products listed in Schedule A of this agreement in line with the following assumptions:
ollama_generated:
14.9 Other Products Exclusions: Organic Preparations INC. grants Agape ATP International Holding Limited the permission to explore, procure, advertise, distribute, and commercialize products outside of those listed in Schedule A of this agreement, subject to the understanding that the Manufacturer is under no obligation to facilitate or assist in these activities, and any associated risks or liabilities remain solely with the Customer.

Note: This revised clause shifts some responsibility from the Manufacturer to the Customer regarding other products outside the agreed product range, while also clarifying that the Manufacturer is under no obligation to help or support such activities.

__________________________________ ____________________________ Responsibility for the Management and Control of the Electronic Signature of Organic Preparations Inc.

This change emphasizes that the party being bound is responsible for managing and controlling the electronic seal, rather than simply affixing it as the original clause implied. This shifts some responsibility onto the party, making their role more active in the context of using the common seal.
